I know this is a work in progress, and I am looking forward to the updates. I give it a 2 for now.

title: Combat needs fixing
comment: The game is great and it does it's job as a timesuck, but the combat ruins a lot of the potential. But I suspect the number generators are off just a bit.

title: Fun game with limitless replay value
comment: A fun old school style RPG, with a lot of areas to explore and quests, especially with the latest updates.  With different factions and sides to choose, various skills, and level up options there is plenty of replay value even if some of the quests aren't finished yet.  And on top of that, it's free with no ads, permissions, or in-app purchases.  And virtually unlimited game saves so you can try every choice.

title: Fantastic Game
comment: Reminiscent of the open world Role Playing Games of our past, this game boasts tried and true mechanics and mathematically (though also heavily luck) based combat. The world is vast, though some areas are still currently under construction. The sprites are mostly from other games, Fire Emblem being one of them, but that can be overlooked by the smooth, intuitive gameplay. The quests are numerous, and the intrigue between different sociopolitical groups enthralling. I do have a few complaints, but it's free.

I'd much rather have things determined more by initiative modifiers etc, rather than tapping away. :-(  Other than that (and the lack of sound) this game is actually pretty good. Stat's galore! title: Mixed feelings
comment: I've played this game for a long time; i have partecipated in the online community. I enjoyed Andor's Trail, but i have some issues with it. some pretty BIG issues.  First, this (very nice, very well written RPG) requires you to grind .. a lot.   And to be honest, that's not entirely bad - it's a mobile-phone RPG, so the grinding actually comes useful at times, when you have a moment of boredom during your day,  waiting for the bus, at lunch, or whatever, just open it, grind a few mobs, and put it back in your pocket.  But you will need to grind quite a lot to advance in the story.  Second, while the game is very nice ... it's not finished. NOWHERE near finished. It will never be.  There's not been a single update in a whole year and there was ONE update in  the year before that. I've basically been playing it since early 2011 and i've seen a two updates, one very minor, since.  And that's a real shame, since the story and writing are so good. But after playing it basically every day for two years straight i just couldn't take it anymore and deleted it.  Android is just not a good platform to build a full bodied RPG.  Sorry guys, but honestly i can't be asked to wait forever.

title: Continues a legacy of excellence
comment: While unfinished, this game continues a long line of excellent games I have played in this genre. Fans of classics such as Larn, Castle of the Winds, Nethack, and surprisingly, Fallout 1 and 2 will find familiar elements to those games and enjoy themselves immensely. There is a minor learning curve at the beginning, and quite a bit of grinding is needed, but this A+ game is a must have for any android user. Remembering that this game is still in the works is vital, but I recommend everyone to get this game!

title: Slow start
comment: I love that it's open source and free. This game is unique in that it is built to require patience and strategy. It takes a long time to build up enough survivability to wander between towns and complete dungeons.  You either have to work to build up your character, or learn how to be strategic in approaching multiple creatures, and eventually both. This means it has a learning curve that can be frustrating in the beginning, but is rewarding later on. Most games would provide gold for sale to satiate the impatient, but not this one.

title: Old Skool graphics, Epic gameplay.
comment: It doesn't take long before you realise that this game has all the important elements of a true RPG: players can choose sides in many quests with varying results and with a lasting impact on the game; Character development is varied enough to warrant multiple playthroughs and forces tactical descisions based on your own style of play; Hard to find legendary items, unique items and a multitude of other equipment makes almost every players experience unique; A great forum where you can find help, or even contribute to making the game even better, Is dominated by active and most importantly, friendly people who are willing to listen to user's views. If you don't mind old skool graphics, and no hollywood effects, but love developing a character your own way while following a story you manipulate by in-game choices, then this is the game for you.

title: Excellent Work in Progress
comment: This game gives you a true RPG feel on your mobile. The open-quest storyline is easy to follow without being too restrictive. There is a nice balance between 'go to point A and grab item B' and 'find item C somewhere in the game'. The point is, the game is very enjoyable and keeps you moving forward. As with most RPGs, the most difficult balance to achieve is very askew in this game. The economy is lacking. Players will be more encouraged to grind for food (meat) rather than XP. Still great fun!
Overall a good game controls are in need of some work though
